answers.answer: I had 2 c-sections but no headaches, how long ago was your c-section? r u still taking pain medication prescribed after c-section? May be from medications combination, or u r very exhausted, of coarse everything is possible.
I agree with ^^^ it probably isnt the c section but everything that comes with it. The lack of sleep, tending to a newborn,  the crying and still having to maintain yourself.
I did after my c section. I ended up needing a blood patch. I was leaking spinal fluid from where they injected me with the spinal block.

Not from the c section I never had them but my sister did she had a vaginal birth the headaches r due to a bad epidural or spinal u need to go to the er hun depending on how bad it is u could need a blood patch. Whats happening is your spinal fluid is leaking. Go in pls and let us know how ur doing. My sister almost died so pls be safe

It is likely because of the spinal. It is one of the risks of the pain medication. Talk to your doctor asap to make sure that is all it is. Chances are they will go away after a few weeks but go to your doctor to male sure.

If when they did the spinal, they went too far, you will have headaches. You can either wait them out and they will eventually go away, or you can go in and have a blood patch where they fix the spot in your spine where they went too far. That would take care of it almost immediately.   As the previous posted stated, it's always best to inform your doctor of your symptoms so they can help you the best way with the most information. No need to suffer needlessly.
While the spinal is likely the culprit it could also be tension headaches. I'd definitely bring it up at your check up. Sooner if they are really bad. Hope you can find some relief.

I had my emergency c section 3 weeks ago and i did have a spinal block. I also have pre eclampsia and HELLP syndrome, a blood transfusion and i was over dosed with magnesium... what do they have to do for a blood patch

I also had an emergency c section due to preeclampsia with my first.A blood patch is where they take blood from your arm and inject it into the space where you had the spinal block. The purpose is for the blood to clot the leak. My migraine went away immediately afterwards.

question: Anyone who had a c section are nonstop headaches common after a c section?! Nothing seems to help it
title: after c section
